page.title: 19THE WOODLAND CLUB
page.content:
{The Woodland Club}was originally an army hut bought by Capt. Birkin of Tacolneston Hall for ex_servicemen after the 1st World War. It was the British Legion Woodland Club until 1968 when W.Wincup & E.Berry took over & opened it as a club anyone could join. There were{60 members}then & the subscription was{2/6d.
In the late 1970's a function room was built & the bar completely renovated, since then a kitchen & new toilets have been added. At present there are {235 members}& the yearly subscription is{Â£2.50. They have karate,ladies keep fit,pool, ladies & mens darts. The function room is used for discos & parties & there is live entertainment in the bar. The club is run by a committee & there are 3 trustees.
